desc: The DUSP4 gene encodes a protein tyrosine/threonine phosphatase that specifically dephosphorylates mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) effectors ERK1/2 (PMID: 7535768). DUSP4 itself is a transcriptional output target of MAPK-activated ERK1/2, and in turn inhibits ERK1/2 through a negative feedback mechanism, thus tempering MAPK-induced cell growth and proliferation (PMID: 22430215). Copy number losses encompassing the DUSP4 locus are observed in a subset of prostate and lung cancers, among others (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Nov 2016).

articles.title: Isolation and characterization of a novel dual specific phosphatase, HVH2, which selectively dephosphorylates the mitogen-activated protein kinase.
articles.reference: Guan KL et al. The Journal of biological chemistry. 1995 Mar 31;270(13)7197-203.

articles.title: Oncogenic KRAS and BRAF activation of the MEK/ERK signaling pathway promotes expression of dual-specificity phosphatase 4 (DUSP4/MKP2) resulting in nuclear ERK1/2 inhibition.
articles.reference: Cagnol S et al. Oncogene. 2013 Jan 31;32(5)564-76.

desc: DUSP4, a protein phosphatase, is deleted in a small subset of prostate and lung cancers.
